summary: If you're using Alternate Start - Live Another Life and Vampiric Thirst together you may encounter a problem starting as a Vampire at Maras Eye Pond. This little patch prevents you from getting eaten right away.
descriptionHtml:
[size=4]Patch for Alternate Start - Live Another Live ([b]2.5.2a[/b]) in combination with Vampiric Thirst (2.61)[/size]
Version 0.1

[b][u]Description[/u][/b]

Combined, these modifications [b]may[/b] lead to a problem at the Maras Eye Pond as a vampire (ASLAL: "Secluded Lair"-Option). After choosing to spawn as a vampire in said lair you get attacked by the occupants, or at least some of you as I've not found that much regarding this issue. Therefore I've wrote a little Patch which puts every occupant into a newly created faction so they won't attack you.

[u][b]Requirements[/b][/u]

Since I'm not adding but just fixing things up you don't need to install anything else for this to work, but I'll write it down nonetheless:
- SKSE
- Dawnguard
- Alternate Start - Live Another Life
- Vampiric Thirst

[b][u]Install

[/u][/b]If you use NMM, then simply add the Archive to your list and activate the mod.
If you don't use NMM,
(1) copy the .esp-file into your [b]"Skyrim/Data"[/b] folder and
(2) copy the file name into your plugins.txt and loadorder.txt located in "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Skyrim" or activate it through your Skyrim Launcher.

[u][b]Uninstall

[/b][/u]Just remove the .esp-file. It doesn't alter anything in your savegame and therefore should be not causing any problems.

[u][b]TODO

[/b][/u]Factions are not considered right now, e.g. random Vigilants of Stendarr in the cages could get friendly, not tested, though.

If you happen to have an idea what needs to be fixed or if things don't seem to work anymore because of a new version of ASLAL or VT, let me
know!

[u][b]Credits[/b][/u]

.. go out to Arthmoor for his great mod Alternate Start and of course MsLeeches for her great Vampiric Thirst (I loved VtMB).
author: teslaCova
